Grand Street, north side, east from but not including Scammel, to but not including Columbia Streets, as seen from East Broadway. Also shown is East Broadway, south side, east from but not including Scammel Street.
April 1, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date, showing a new apartment house erected by Governer Lehman on the site of the R. Hoe and Company Plant.
October 12, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, viewed westward and showing new slum clearance project completed.
July 22, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

473-467 Grand Street, at, adjoining and west of the S.W. corner of Scammel Street. The 5-story building (No. 473), is directly at the corner. Shown on the right, is No. 278 Division Street (building with flag on roof) which adjoins the building (partially shown, No. 277), directly at the S.E. corner of Gouverneur Street. These buildings physically are on the same block, but arbitrarily bear numbers on different streets.

April 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Grand Street (left), north side, east from, but not including Scammel to Columbia Streets, as seen from East Broadway, showing the R. Hoe & Co. plant between Sheriff and Columbia Streets. On the right appears houses on the south side of East Broadway, east from Scammel to Grand Streets.

April 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)
Grand Street,north side and west from,but not including Pitt Street. Note St.Mary's R.C. Church at the N.W. corner of
Ridge Street.

July 22nd,1936

(2)Grand Street,north side,at a point farther south and west from Scammel Street,showing the Neighbourhood Theatre and the towers of St.Mary's R.C. church at the corner of Ridge Street.

May 7th,1939

Photographs by,
P.L.Sperr,
No 'eproductions.
